Row.Text: An elder of this remote village has died. The body is wrapped in a vibrant, handwoven textile – in its colors and patterns, the stories of its creators.
Builders have raised a monolith, effortlessly and with few tools. The artisans back home will want to know of these novel techniques.
Folk have gathered to celebrate a god of plenty. Dancers drink and make merry. Gamblers cluster together. In the morning they tally their fortunes.
This place of respite has sheltered countless travelers, a symbol of humanity’s perseverance in spite of a hostile wilderness.
Leave a gift for future travelers.
Diggers have uncovered evidence of forgotten waterworks. This could be used for farming or for urban infrastructure.
Explorers have discovered a network of hot springs. These vapors offer respite for the weary traveler and inspiration for the poet. Paradise does not remain secret for long.
Astronomers have crafted a tool for measuring the stars, hoping to discern meaning from their movements. The mysteries of the universe widen.
Hunters have perfected a recipe for curing meat so that it does not spoil – perfect for travelers enduring prolonged journeys.
A trader has obtained a cargo of spices from afar. The weightless herbs crumble to dust in the hand, and are sure to become a sensation before long.
An aging recluse has opened their homestead to orphans. He is ailing, but the children seem able to sustain the land.
A hunter has crafted an ingenious new portable trap. Techniques this elegant are sure to spread fast.
Refugees have settled near a grove of berry bushes – vital nourishment. The juices also produce a dye that may catch the eyes of marketgoers.
A group of dancers has withdrawn to the wilderness to focus on their craft. They stretch their bodies as they reach for perfection. Those who touch it become legends.
Explorers have recovered the obscure writings of a local sage – poetic ruminations on death stained with tears.
Soldiers have tracked a horde of bandits to their stolen treasure. Debts must be repaid.
Shepherds have found a cave perfect for aging various cheeses. Locals find their unique musk irresistible – those in the capital will find them a pure delicacy.
Scholars have been debating the origins of images adorning the mouth of a cave. The animal shapes are unfamiliar. The handprints next to them are not.
Foragers have discovered an unknown type of mushroom. But such morsels warrant caution; they should not be eaten until they are studied.
Test if they can be eaten safely.
Miners digging for iron have stumbled across a vein of silver within the hollow of a mountain. Blacksmiths will offer a fair price for such a precious resource.
Share the profits with the hardest workers.
Artisans have refined a technique for making glass, pouring molten sand into unique clay molds. The dust of the Earth is cooked into captivating charms.
Pilgrims have carved a trail to a rock formation offering a stunning view of the coastline. Such natural beauty is sure to attract poets – who will struggle to capture its splendor.
Fishermen have befriended a pod of dolphins. The animals weave through the water, threading their way into the fabric of the community.
Blacksmiths at this seaside forge have taken to using salt brine to quench their metal. Traders will clamber for this superior steel.
Traders have come ashore bearing the wisdom of faraway places. Scholars back home would stumble over themselves to hear these stories.
A community has organized a festival celebrating the oyster harvest. Mollusks roast over heated stones while travelers trade mouthwatering recipes.
Surveyors have devised a specialized rod for measuring coastlines – sizing up the world one calculation at a time. Mapmakers will be eager to test its worth.
Several soldiers have gathered for an impromptu contest of sport. News of one contender's stunning victory is sure to ripple across the empire.
Players use long sticks to whip a wicker ball across a grassy field, as wealthy patrons look on. A goal is scored – bets are collected. Visitors are taught how to play.
An orator has attracted an audience of rapt congregants, extolling the virtues of hard work, and promising salvation through obedience.
A party of noblemen has had a successful hunt. They instruct their servants to leave what they cannot carry, but there's no shortage of hungry mouths back home.
Devotees have come to see an idol of their faith. The worshippers, many of whom traveled from afar, rejoice in its presence and are generous with their tithes.
Traveling merchants have set up a fair at a crossroads. Visitors gawk at curios and take part in lively entertainments before returning to the road.
A family of nomads has perfected the crafting of pottery in pit fires. The wares will sell handsomely at market, and the potters aren't shy about their ingenious techniques.
Resell the creations at a higher price.
Soldiers have caught bandits masquerading as aristocrats. They claim they are no worse than those they imitate, but are stripped of their counterfeit attire nonetheless.
Punish the bandits with hard labor.
Weary soldiers have been guarding a crumbling fort. They say they await orders, but months have passed without news or supply. Some fear they've been abandoned.
Worshippers have congregated under the torchlight of a shrine. The image of their deity looks down on them from a pedestal, forgotten by some, but not all.
Scavengers have unearthed an ancient clockwork device – the heavens themselves cast in miniature. To know our place in the cosmos is to know ourselves.
Charge a fee to marvel at the device.
This dilapidated winery hasn't operated in quite some time – but its cellars contain a trove of untouched jars, ripe for the pillaging.
The discontented subjects of a departed lord have disturbed his tomb. They haul out the riches buried with him, tribute stolen from their own chapped hands.
Artisans have set up a commune along a busy road. Some wield hammers, others brushes. Trades passed onto them, which they will pass on in turn.
Have the artisans teach their skills.
Hunters have set up camp in a quiet forest. They complain of their neighbors, who encroach on their lands and cull the wildlife. Still, they are happy to trade what they have.
A small band of soldiers, canny engineers among them, has fled their homeland, cursing their despotic general. They long for a more fulfilling purpose.
Encourage them to make their own fates.
Workers have stopped mining a quarry for lack of pay. The supervisor threatens punishment, but quickly realizes the size of the crowd.
Take their money while they argue.
A band of soldiers – their flag and faces unfamiliar – has kept a well-ordered but tattered camp in the wilderness. They have given up on home and need work to do and a place to settle.
A calamity has swept through, leaving wood and clay splintered, charred, and broken. Some have escaped. Others were not so lucky.
Leave an offering to the dead.
Votive figures have been flung across the landscape. For the slain, they may be comfort; for their orphans, signs of devotion. For those in the capital, thrilling curiosities.
Leave the votive figures for the dead.
Raiders have repeatedly plagued a remote market town. A few townsfolk think they can rebuild – again – but most agree they would feel safer in the cities.
Wildfires have left a once-flourishing garden in ruin. The acolytes who tended the rare plants here comb the detritus for salvage, hoping they can rebuild.
Study what's left of the rare plants.
Severe drought has left these farmlands dormant. But the farmers, relentless, have devised a plan to irrigate – replenishing lands and spirits both.
Soldiers have just been here – their campfires are still warm, and there are supplies packed in anticipation for their return. However, just now, all is still and quiet.
Demolish the camp and erect a banner.
A petty warlord has driven a community of artisans from their home. They had been building chariots – anyone who helps reclaim their home is welcome to them.
Help the artisans reclaim their home.
The warlord is gone, happy with a small bribe. The artisans are only too eager to return to work.
A poet has been driven into hiding because his provocative remarks have offended townsfolk. But none can deny his talents.
The townsfolk welcome back the poet. Some secretly smile.
Farmers have been toiling over a stony tract of land with little success. If nothing can take root in its ground, maybe something can graze over it.
Give the land over to horses.
Recover the seeds to harvest elsewhere.
Where grain once withered, horses now prosper. They will make excellent mounts.
The fallen dead of a nearby conflict have been left without a resting place. A proper cemetery would honor them, and draw pilgrims from far and wide.
Commission a cemetery to honor the fallen.
The dead are laid to rest in solemn tombs, to be watched over by ageless sentinels for eternity.
Farmers have noticed that evening temperatures are perfect for the grapes that grow here. If they were to establish a vineyard, the wine would flow for miles and miles.
Take some grapes and move on.
The vineyard has begun to flourish, its wines renowned for their robust flavor.
Famine has left breeders without sufficient pasture for their animals. Close to desperation, they are willing to part with a few in exchange for a place to graze.
The grateful breeders offer as thanks some of their most agile mounts, well-suited for the cavalry.
An unorthodox sect has taken up residence on this hill. They feel their practices are not welcome in the cities.
Gain 1 Population in the nearest Settlement.
They are outcasts for a reason. Ignore them.
Gain 1 Population in the nearest Settlement.
With eyes full of trepidation, the group sets their course for a new home.
Surveyors have discovered a source of gypsum – soft stone perfect for fine carving. But the stone rests under a wealthy family's ancestral shrines.
Take what gypsum is lying on the ground.
The landowners hide their anger well, but not completely. The mine prospers.
A pack of wolves has been driven from their home by human expansion. They have begun threatening travelers, frustrating the nearby village of {1_Independent}'s helpless officials.
Hire hunters to deal with the wolf problem.
Travelers leaving {1_Independent} return to the road, feeling safe again.
A celebrated diplomat has retreated to a sacred site to copy withering religious texts. Her oratory skills are wasted here, but she refuses to leave these documents to fade.
These religious texts will not be forgotten. In gratitude, the diplomat agrees to take up the concerns of the {1_civilization_adj} civilization.
A massive sinkhole has opened near a struggling community, revealing a collapsed silver mine. The residents are elated, but question their safety.
With a properly reinforced mineworks, the community begins to see an end to its struggles.
Sea turtles have begun to nest here. Locals wait in anticipation of the eggs hatching, to be moved by one of nature’s many cycles.
Celebrate the cycle of life with a festival.
The festival has become an annual occurrence. Folk come from near and far to rejoice in life, the sea turtles’ and their own.
A burgeoning merchant outpost has been terrorized by frequent coastal storms. The opportunity for trade is ripe, but the risk is great without a seawall.
As the seawalls hold back an angry sea, the merchants bustle about – already drafting plans to expand the market.
The gods have favored them with a more abundant harvest than they could ever need, fishermen say. They don't wish it to spoil, but aim to be compensated for their labor.
Traders haul carts of fresh fish back to the city, where they will surely get twice what they paid for them.
Locals claim that in this glade, objects roll towards the center, regardless of the slope.
Gain a boost to the earliest available Technology.
The oddity is an illusion, but thinkers have begun to experiment with perspective.
The locals here have become proficient at hunting on horseback and would make excellent cavalry. But traditional saddles won't fit their unique riding style.
Develop a saddle for the riders.
The horsemen find the saddles unwieldy at first, but quickly discover their benefits.
A group of refugees has survived a shipwreck, their numerous faces molded by years of hardship. Their bodies may be battered, but their spirits are completely broken.
The refugees came seeking asylum. They found something greater: acceptance.
Local healers treat wounds with the thick mats of kelp that wash up on the shore.
These healers have raised vital questions about the nature of injury and infection.
Pearl-divers have made this stretch of coast a favorite site, but they do not allow others access.
Locals now permit outsiders to harvest pearls, but they do so with stony stares and muttered curses.
An especially rich nomad encampment – and its sizeable herd – brings color to the landscape. They are hard bargainers, but are willing to make a deal.
Make a deal for the cattle.
The cattle begin their march towards the abattoir.
Manuscripts have been recovered from a collapsed archive. But the ravages of time have left their secrets unintelligible.
Study the manuscripts for scientific knowledge.
Gain a boost to the earliest available Technology.
After careful reading, the manuscripts spark new ideas.
A fierce group of archers lives in these areas, skilled but proud. Their skills would be a powerful addition to the military, if they could be convinced.
Find common ground with the hunters.
The bow hunters settle into their barracks – uneasily at first, but they carouse with the other soldiers in time.
Representatives from the independent village of {1_Independent} have expressed concerns over a nearby mercenary camp. The soldiers say they merely wish to rest. But the flag they fly is suspicious.
The mercenaries' presence is no more welcome in {1_Capital}, but at least {2_Independent} is relieved.
A herd of prized cattle has stopped to graze. Their rich meat is a delicacy back home, but the cowherds say they are bound for nearby {1_Independent}.
{1_independent} becomes Hostile (removes all progress towards Befriending) and sends a Raid to {2_capital}.
A meal isn't worth an enemy.
The beef is gone virtually overnight, while relations with {1_Independent} are permanently stained. Many consider it a fair trade.
A mining operation has stumbled across a trove of unusually strong crystals – they do not scratch or melt. Their practical value remains undetermined.
The purest stones carry an enchanting polish; keen jewelers will pay handsomely.
Some archers have managed to survive a conflict that bore no victor. They no longer have a flag, but this is the only life they know.
Let them find their own way.
The archers check the condition of their bows, preparing them for the next battle.
Animals have broken from the confines of a wealthy noble's menagerie and run amok. They are no longer fit for the wilds, but clearly were not happy.
Build the animals a proper home.
The animals return to a more accommodating shelter – where they can be studied and enjoyed.
A temple complex has fallen into disrepair, despite its residents' best efforts. The foundations are too unstable, but the acolytes won't leave their shrine behind.
Devise a way to move the shrine safely.
Leave the acolytes to their problem.
The acolytes find a new place for them and their shrine at the city's outskirts, ready to start again.
Mercenaries have been seeking their next engagement, and are willing to do anything for the right price. But can loyalty be bought?
Let them seek their fortune elsewhere.
The mercenaries find the pay sufficient, and begin packing their things.
A crowd has become captivated by a troupe of players. They deserve an audience that can fully appreciate their talents.
People come from all over to see the thespians perform, to enrich their spirits.
A wilderness shrine lies in a tranquil grotto. Its devotees promise healing – and silence.
Recruit those who wish more in their lives.
The calm of the shrine lingers, even after one has long departed.
A band of thieves had all once been accomplished artists, only turning to crime out of necessity. They regret their actions, but will have to earn back their place in society.
Many are wary of the reformed criminals, but the artists hope to win back their hearts.
A beloved prophet has been exposed as a charlatan by followers who claim they were bled of all their wealth. They don't care about the money, they say – only justice.
The charlatan is hauled away in chains, while his former followers consider their folly.
An excavation has uncovered a bone the length of an entire person, with signs that there may be more. Could this be the winged dragon of legend?
Curiously, the reconstructed skeleton lacks wings. News of the maimed dragon begins to spread.
A group of nomads has noticed that the cattle they follow have dwindled. Many argue that their way of life is no longer sustainable.
Find a place for the cattle herders to settle.
Gain 1 Population in the nearest Settlement.
Gain 1 Population in the nearest Settlement.
No longer nomadic, the cattle herders have begun to adjust to their new lives.
Scavengers picking through battlefield remains begin play-fighting with rusted swords. Their form needs work, but the swings are solid.
Find room for them in the reserves.
The scavengers' rusty swords have been replaced with sharp ones, ready for the next battlefield.
Among her sundries, a merchant has long held an assortment of texts in an unusual script. Wary of what they might say, she offers the manuscripts to any who is willing to take them.
Attempt to translate the strange texts.
Give the strange texts to a scholar for study.
The texts document numerous failed attempts to complete certain ambitious experiments – but where some failed, perhaps others can succeed.
Seeking shade, herders have stumbled upon the long-neglected tomb of a sage, its funerary slab covered with cryptic markings and swirling forms. Curiosity has turned to debate over its true worth.
For generations, a clan of weavers has spun fabrics prized for their warmth and strength. Now, in a rare show of respect, the head weaver offers to share their secret technique.
Shell collectors have found a series of strange shapes beneath the waves – low stone enclosures crumbling among coral, once used to trap schools of fish with the rhythm of the tides.
Ship the stones home for construction.
A lonely shepherd has carved a flute from a hollow reed. Its melodies ride the wind, inviting those who long for home to follow its call.
The hollow within a mysterious mound has been uncovered, its passageway aligned so the winter solstice sun illuminates its inner chamber. Local priests insist the site be preserved as sacred.
Measure celestial movements at the site.

Inside a collapsed stronghold, workers have unearthed a ceremonial dagger engraved with the sigil of a once-mighty commander. The find would be invaluable to its original heirs … but a rival house could probably name a price.
Return the armor to its owner.
A spice harvester has been venturing deep into the forest to harvest wild cloves in secret. These dried buds fetch more than their weight in silver – so long as no one else finds the grove.
Share this spice; it prevents spoilage.
The bodies of two feuding merchants lie by the roadside, their dispute settled in blood. As birds circle overhead, passing travelers have begun to squabble over the abandoned wares.
The goods pass to the merchants' kin.

Potters have been experimenting with ceramic coatings that create an arresting glow. Their bowls catch the sunlight, dazzling the eye, but the firing process must be meticulously controlled to avoid an uneven finish.
Mastering the kiln is the mark of true craft.
This labor is hardly worth the shine.
Smoke curls through the air as the potters lift their creation from the kiln – the vessel's lustrous surface still hot to the touch.
A cache of grave goods contains an ingenious whistle. When blown, it emits a chilling shriek, like a spirit returning from the dead. It could be useful.
Warriors will wield it in battle.
The whistle’s shriek cuts through the morning fog, a warning to all {1_CIVILIZATION_ADJ} foes.

A salvage team has pulled a fractured religious icon from the wreckage of a sunken ship. They believe the icon's desecration cursed the voyage, but one engineer insists an unbalanced keel caused the vessel to tip.
Shipwrights should heed this vessel’s failings.
Restore the relic to still the sea.
Bent beneath a ship's hull, a shipbuilder measures the keel with deliberate care, knowing it must meet the ocean's might.
A band of wandering archers looses volley after volley, each arrow landing with uncanny precision. A gathered crowd watches in awe.
With bows strapped to their backs, the archers stand ready to march like a storm across the earth.
Workers have been digging out an exhausted well, hoping to strike water. Instead, the foreman unearths a pale stone with dark veins that coil like frozen smoke.
Seek a larger marble deposit below.
Let artisans give the stone worth.
The cliff breaks beneath ringing hammers, and a wall of marble is revealed, pale as moonlight trapped in stone.

A temple once filled with voices of outspoken philosophers – fierce critics of {1_CIVILIZATION_ADJ} rule – has burned to the ground. The priests claim they've lost more than a building; they’ve lost the spirit of independent thought.
Mourn the fall of a cherished landmark.
Frame the loss as divine judgment.
In time all buildings turn to dust – but great ideas may linger where walls once stood.

Brigands have been raiding the merchant caravans that frequent nearby villages, taking a torch to everything that is useless to them. The smoke is a clear warning to give {1_independent} a wide berth.
{1_independent} becomes Hostile (removes all progress towards Befriending) and sends a Raid to {2_capital}.
